title: Can we get different Types of Target Dummies in Practice Tool?
body:
Pretty self-explanatory, if you're like me and like to mess around in practice tool then you realized probably that you can't really test out something like how would a build work vs a 300 armor/Mr enemy or how would it work vs a 70 armor squishy,or how the fact that you can only choose a 10k hp dummy messes up some numbers when you use certain items like Botrk or Liandry .

I'd just like to see some variety in the Dummy department implemented so we can better test some things vs high resistance targets,even better it would be to have the ability to invite at least 1 person,so many times i wonder which build is better for a 1v1 scenario but you can't really test that out in a regular game because there's too many variables,you could make a custom game but you'd still have to waste at least 15 minutes farming to get some items to test.

Also you can't even test things like Tenacity in practice tool,at least have one dummy that can CC and show the time that stun/root/slow was in place so we can test out different options like Legend: Tenacity and how it pairs with merc treads

replies.body: I would like a dummy that you can actually kill, so we can actually do certain executions in the mode.
And dummies with a pre-selected walking path to practice landing skillshots. It'd be nice cause in most scenarios your opponent does not stand completely still.
Just make it so you can add bots to the practice tool?
That's an option for sure, but having a dummy walk a pre-selected path would let a lot of people train on different combos. For example insecing as lee sin.

Like Spawn> Pick Champion
Then, set level and items on champion. 

Ex: 
Spawn - Tabbed Window comes out - Pick {{champion:57}} from list like the forums.
Items - Tabbed Window comes out - Click {{item:3076}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3800}} from list like the forums.

Set - Creates cursor to set spawn location. Spawns Level 14 {{champion:57}} with {{item:3076}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3800}} equipped at targeted location. The Maokai doesn't attack or anything, just acts as a target dummy except with realistic stats to practice against.

+1
In my experience, practice mode feels extremely useless right now (other than testing what the DPS of a build is or CSing).
This is a great idea.

http://www.auplod.com/u/lapuoda6bee.png

Giving us better practice dummies is at the top of my wishlist of features for this game. I love to experiment with different builds and strategies, but I don't want to have to do tedious math all day to optimize when a fully functional practice tool would allow me to achieve the same thing in minutes. 
Sometimes I just can't be bothered to do the math. And many players don't even know how to do it, or where to find the information to do it. 

A million health dummy with 100 MR is not useful for any kind of build testing. %health is all screwed up, and no champion has a base of 100 MR even at level 18. 

We need the option to set the health and resistance of the dummy, or at the very least to select from a few options that better reflect real enemy champions.
I think we need a Training Grounds map similar to Overwatch's testing mode - with dummies that perform specific actions, are capable of dying/respawning, etc.
